feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Run
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Run

entry.content: You can [disable the built-in `run.app` URL](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/securing/ingress) of a Cloud Run service to ensure that traffic can only ingress through paths that you've explicitly configured ([GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)).
entry.summary: You can now disable the built-in `run.app` URL for your Cloud Run services. This allows you to control traffic ingress more granularly, ensuring it only passes through your configured paths. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run: Disable built-in `run.app` URL

entry.content:
Compute flexible committed use discounts (CUDs) have expanded to also cover your Cloud Billing account's spend across Cloud Run services with request-based billing and Cloud Run functions.
The [improved spend-based CUD experience](https://cloud.google.com/docs/cuds-multiprice) is available without requiring an opt-in for new users or users who don't have an active spend-based CUD.
To learn more about how opting into the new model affects your flexible CUDs, see [Committed use discounts](https://cloud.google.com/run/cud).
entry.summary: You can now use flexible committed use discounts to cover your Cloud Billing account's spend on Cloud Run services with request-based billing and Cloud Run functions. This feature is automatically available for new users and those without active spend-based CUDs.
entry.title: Feature: Flexible CUDs now cover Cloud Run

entry.summary: Google Cloud Run now supports the Go 1.24 runtime in preview. This update allows developers to leverage the latest features and improvements in the Go programming language for their serverless applications.
entry.title: Feature: Go 1.24 runtime support in preview

entry.content: You can [apply maximum instance configuration](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/max-instances#service-vs-revision-level) at the service level (in Preview).
entry.summary: You can now set the maximum instance configuration at the service level. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Maximum instance configuration at service level

entry.content: Cloud Run [worker pools](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/deploy-worker-pools) are now available (Preview). Worker pools are specifically designed for non-request workloads.
entry.summary: Cloud Run worker pools are now available in preview. This feature is designed for non-request driven workloads.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run worker pools now available in preview

entry.content: A new region is now available for [Cloud Run GPUs](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/gpu#supported-regions): `us-east4`.
entry.summary: A new region, us-east4, is now available for Cloud Run GPUs.
entry.title: Feature: New region available for Cloud Run GPUs

entry.content: Support for the [PHP 8.4 runtime](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtime-support#php) is in [General Availability (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products/?_gl=1*dplot*_ga*MTM2MDk5MzEzMi4xNzQ1ODg0OTY5*_ga_4LYFWVHBEB*MTc0NjE0MTA3Ny4yMi4xLjE3NDYxNDEwOTYuMC4wLjA.#product-launch-stages).
entry.summary: PHP 8.4 runtime is now generally available on Google Cloud Run, offering enhanced features and performance for your applications.
entry.title: Feature: PHP 8.4 runtime now available on Cloud Run

entry.content: Support for the [Ruby 3.4 runtime](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtime-support#ruby) is in [General Availability (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products/?_gl=1*dplot*_ga*MTM2MDk5MzEzMi4xNzQ1ODg0OTY5*_ga_4LYFWVHBEB*MTc0NjE0MTA3Ny4yMi4xLjE3NDYxNDEwOTYuMC4wLjA.#product-launch-stages).
entry.summary: Ruby 3.4 runtime is now generally available in Google Cloud Run, offering improved performance and features.
entry.title: Feature: Ruby 3.4 runtime now available

entry.content: You can [configure GPU](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/jobs/gpu) in your Cloud Run job (Preview).
entry.summary: You can now configure GPUs in your Cloud Run jobs to run even more demanding workloads.
entry.title: Feature: Configure GPU in Cloud Run Jobs

entry.content: You can [use request host and request path in IAM Conditions](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/securing/managing-access#conditions) when defining access control for invoking Cloud Run services.
entry.summary: You can now use request host and request path in IAM Conditions to manage access control for your Cloud Run services. This provides more granular control over who can invoke your services.
entry.title: Feature: IAM Conditions for Cloud Run

entry.content: For Java Cloud Run functions that use `functions-framework` version 1.4.0 or later, you can now use the logging class `java.util.logging.Logger` to add a [unique execution ID](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtimes/java#execution_id) to log outputs.
entry.summary: You can now add a unique execution ID to your Java Cloud Run function logs using the `java.util.logging.Logger` class. This feature is available for functions using `functions-framework` version 1.4.0 and later.
entry.title: Feature: Execution ID logging for Java Cloud Run

entry.content: Multiple regions now benefit from enhanced responsiveness for latency-sensitive applications for [Cloud Run service URLs](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/triggering/https-request#url).
entry.summary: Latency-sensitive applications using Cloud Run service URLs now have improved responsiveness across multiple regions.
entry.title: Feature: Enhanced Responsiveness for Cloud Run Service URLs
